hanzi-su-wiki:
競

Значения

Соперничать; продавать с торгов; борьба мнений, конкуренция, соперничество

Мнемоника

Юные 立 соперники по диспуту 口, которые возбужденно ходят 儿.

Варианты

竞, 竸
purpleculture_pinyin:
jìng
to compete; to contend; to struggle
завершить; спорить; бороться
rtega_mnemonic:
競競RS
竞竞		contend, vie, compete, emulate
  • two standing 立 men 兄 either competing or emulating each other: 竞竞
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 竞)
Ideographic: Two people 竞 locked in a struggle
purpleculture_examples:
競爭 [ jìng zhēng ]: to compete; competition
競爭力 [ jìng zhēng lì ]: competitive strength; competitiveness
競賽 [ jìng sài ]: race; competition; Classifiers: 个
競選 [ jìng xuǎn ]: to take part in an election; to run for office
競技 [ jìng jì ]: competition of skill (e.g. sports); athletics tournament
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 竞 [ jìng ] to compete, to contend, to vie
    • 竞 [ jìng ] to compete, to contend, to vie
heisig_chinese_memo: Two twin brothers are competeing (vie) for the title of who is the elder brother. The game is that they must balance a vase on their head and the one who drops his loses and becomes the younger brother!
heisig_constituent: vie, vase, stand up, elder brother, teenager, mouth, human legs, vase2, stand up2, elder brother2, teenager2, mouth2, human legs2
heisig_story: Two teenagers are seen here standing up to one another, vying for the attention of their peers.
Keyword_KANJIDIC: emulate, compete with, bid, sell at auction, bout, contest, race
Keyword_KANJIDIC_ru: эмулировать, соперничают с, ставка, продать на аукционе, бой, конкурс, гонки
koohiiStory1: TWO twin BROTHERS are competing (VYING) for the title of who is the older BROTHER. The game is that they must balance a VASE on their head and the one who drops his looses and becomes the younger BROTHER!
koohiiStory2: Two crazy brothers vying for the guiness records books of stupidity by trying to stand on their heads the longest.
jp_example_words:
競技(きょうぎ): game, match, contest
競馬(けいば): horse racing
競争(きょうそう): compete
jp_readingExamples: 競争 (きょうそう), 競技 (きょうぎ), 競泳 (きょうえい), 競う (きそ.う), 競る (せ.る)
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: Standing next to your older brother is another standing older brother of yours. They're trying to compete, to see which of them can stand the straightest and tallest.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Picture your two older brothers competing like this. Are you going to root for one of them? That's not very nice, you shouldn't have a favorite older brother.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Your older brothers are trying to compete to see which of them gets to go to きょうと with you. You won a free trip to きょうと, but there's only one other ticket, so now your brothers are competing for you.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Look really closely at your older brothers. They're competing pretty hard for your attention. They really want to go to きょうと... but which one do YOU want to spend time with the most?
Ru_Meaning: emulate, compete with, bid, sell at auction, bout, contest, race
Ru_trainchinese: jìng: (графема) конкурировать, соревноваться; (книжн.) с рвением, с нетерпением; (книжн.) сильный, мощный
Kanshudo_mnemonic: you might have to stand (立) on two elder brothers (兄) to compete
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Teenagers get bored and do stupid things.  Here we have a teenager trying to compete with his friends to see who can hold his grandmother's vase on his head the longest.
humanum_full_description_en:
Elaboration: The oracle bone inscriptions start from the two " people " or " big ", the top from " ◎ ", the shape is like a person with a headgear, the whole character is suspected to be two headband accessories competing side by side (Shang Chengzuo, Li Xiaoding), the original meaning is Race is extended to competition. "Zhuangzi. "Qiwu Lun": "There is competition and there is contention", Guo Xiang's note: "And compete with each other." "Shuowen": "Competition, strong language also. One is the same. From the purlin, from the two."

In the inscriptions on inscriptions, it evolved from " purlin ", "Shuawen" "purlin, Jingyan Ye", "reading as a competition." " Jing " has meaning at issue, is " competing " righteous character and sound character. In the middle of the Western Zhou Dynasty, there was a round shape between the two " big " inscriptions. Wu Zhenwu thought it was like a match between two people. Gu Bei said. Or think that the circle is just a pen.

Oracle bone inscriptions are used for sacrificial names and personal names. Bronze inscriptions indicate competition, 㝬 bell: "Death (no) competition", "Poetry. Zhou Song. "Wu": "Yu Huangwu! There is no competition and vigor." "Wu Jing" means incomparable and unmatched (Xu Zhongshu). It is also known as " Jin ", which means national borders and territories. Jing Lizhong: "Save the Rong in Chu Jing (Jing)". Also used as a person's name and clan name.
humanum_short_description_en: Oracle from the second " person " or " large " from the top " ◎ ", with a headdress in the shape of a human being, to compete side by side like two people suspected of whole words ornaments shaped headband (Business Chengzuo, Lee Hyo set), the original meaning is Race is extended to competition.
humanum_full_description:
甲骨文從二「人」或「大」，頂部從「◎」，象人帶頭飾之形，全字疑象二人頭帶飾物並肩競逐之形(商承祚、李孝定)，本義是競跑，引申為競爭。《莊子．齊物論》：「有競有爭」，郭象注：「並逐曰競。」《說文》：「競，彊語也。一曰逐也。从誩，从二人。」

　　至金文演變為從「誩」，《說文》「誩，競言也」，「讀若競」。「誩」有爭論之意，是「競」的義符兼聲符。西周中期金文有於二「大」之間加一圓形，吳振武認為象兩人爭球之形。姑備一說。或認為圓形只是飾筆。

　　甲骨文用作祭名和人名，金文表示競爭，㝬鐘：「亡(無)競」，《詩．周頌．武》：「於皇武王！無競維烈。」「無競」即無與比並、無與爭競之意(徐中舒)。又通假為「境」，表示國境、疆土，荊曆鐘：「救戎於楚競(境)」。又用作人名及族氏名。
humanum_short_description: 甲骨文從二「人」或「大」，頂部從「◎」，象人帶頭飾之形，全字疑象二人頭帶飾物並肩競逐之形(商承祚、李孝定)，本義是競跑，引申為競爭。

甲骨文從二「 人 」或「 大 」，頂部從「 ◎ 」，象人帶頭飾之形，全字疑象二人頭帶飾物並肩競逐之形(商承祚、李孝定)，本義是競跑，引申為競爭。《莊子．齊物論》：「有競有爭」，郭象注：「並逐曰競。」《說文》：「競，彊語也。一曰逐也。从誩，从二人。」 至金文演變為從「 誩 」，《說文》「誩，競言也」，「讀若競」。「 誩 」有爭論之意，是「 競 」的義符兼聲符。西周中期金文有於二「 大 」之間加一圓形，吳振武認為象兩人爭球之形。姑備一說。或認為圓形只是飾筆。 甲骨文用作祭名和人名，金文表示競爭，㝬鐘：「亡(無)競」，《詩．周頌．武》：「於皇武王！無競維烈。」「無競」即無與比並、無與爭競之意(徐中舒)。又通假為「 境 」，表示國境、疆土，荊曆鐘：「救戎於楚競(境)」。又用作人名及族氏名。
Elaboration: The oracle bone inscriptions start from the two " people" or " big", the top from " ◎", the shape is like a person with a headgear, the whole character is suspected to be two headband accessories competing side by side (Shang Chengzuo, Li Xiaoding), the original meaning is Race is extended to competition. "Zhuangzi. "Qiwu Lun": "There is competition and there is contention", Guo Xiang's note: "And compete with each other." "Shuowen": "Competition, strong language also. One is the same. From the purlin, from the two." In the inscriptions on inscriptions, it evolved from " purlin", "Shuawen" "purlin, Jingyan Ye", "reading as a competition." " Jing" has meaning at issue, is " competing" righteous character and sound character. In the middle of the Western Zhou Dynasty, there was a round shape between the two " big" inscriptions. Wu Zhenwu thought it was like a match between two people. Gu Bei said. Or think that the circle is just a pen. Oracle bone inscriptions are used for sacrificial names and personal names. Bronze inscriptions indicate competition, 㝬 bell: "Death (no) competition", "Poetry. Zhou Song. "Wu": "Yu Huangwu! There is no competition and vigor." "Wu Jing" means incomparable and unmatched (Xu Zhongshu). It is also known as " Jin", which means national borders and territories. Jing Lizhong: "Save the Rong in Chu Jing (Jing)". Also used as a person's name and clan name.

競字的基本解释

競
jìng
见“竞”。

競字的汉语字典释义

[①]［jìng］
［《廣韻》渠敬切，去映，羣。］
亦作“竸1”。“竞1”的繁体字。
(1)争竞；角逐；比赛。
(2)趋。
(3)争辩；争闹。
(4)强盛；强劲。
(5)副词。争着；争相。
(6)通“竟”。竟然。
(7)通“境”。

競字的康熙字典解释

【午集下】【立字部】　競； 康熙笔画：19； 页码：页873第22
【廣韻】渠敬切【集韻】【韻會】渠映切【正韻】具映切，?音傹。彊也。【書·立政】乃有室大競。【爾雅·釋詁】競，彊也。【左傳·僖七年】心則不競，何憚于病。　又爭也，逐也，高也，遽也。【詩·商頌】不競不絿。【註】競，逐也。【左傳·襄十年】鄭其有災乎，師競已甚。【註】爭競也。《哀二十三年》：敝邑有社稷之事，使肥與有職競焉。【註】競，遽也。　又【增韻】盛也。【左傳·昭三年】二惠競爽。　又【集韻】或作?。亦作傹。【周禮·春官·鐘師註】繁遏執傹也。【韻會補】又作倞。【開元五經文字】毛詩：秉心無倞。　又借作境。【秦詛楚文】奮兵盛師，以偪?邊競。　又叶居良切。【黃庭經】魂魄內守不爭競，神生腹中銜玉鐺。　又叶其兩切。【詩·大雅】靡所止疑，云徂何往。君子實維，秉心無競。俗作?。

考證：〔【左傳·襄十年】鄭其災乎，師競已甚。〕　謹照原文災上增有字。〔【又】季康子曰，敝邑有社稷之事，使肥與職競焉。〕　謹按此係哀二十三年傳文。謹將又季康子

Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Afternoon Set 2] [Li Zi Department] 　 Jing; Kangxi strokes: 19; Page number: page 873 22
[Guang Yun] Qu Jingqie [Jiyun] [Rhyme Meeting] Qu Yingqie [Zheng Yun] With Yingqie,? Yin Suo. Strong also. 【Book·Lizheng】It is a big competition between rooms. 【Erya·Shiguo】Competition, strong. [Zuo Zhuan·Seven Years of Xi] The heart is not competitive, so he is sick.　 Contending again, chasing, high, and sudden. 【Poetry·Commercial Song】If you don't compete, you won't be 絿. 【Note】Competition, one after another. [Zuo Zhuan·Xiang Ten Years] Zheng Qi is in disaster, and his teacher is already competing. [Note] Competition also. "Twenty-Three Years of Sorrow": There are social affairs in the town, which makes the fat and the job compete. 【Note】Competition is sudden.　[Zeng Yun] Sheng Ye. [Zuo Zhuan·Three Years of Zhao] Erhui Jingshuang.　 [Ji Yun] or Zuo?. Also as a sorrow. 【Zhou Li·Chun Guan·Zhong Shi's Note】Fan curb and clingy. [Rhyme will make up] again. 【Kaiyuan Five Classics】Mao Poems: Bingxin is unrelenting.　 Borrowed as a realm again. [Qin Curse Chuwen] Fenbing Shengshi, to force the side to compete.　 Ye Juliang cut again. 【Huang Ting Jing】The soul is not in contention, and the god is born with a jade clang in the abdomen.　Leave it in two cuts again. 【Poetry·Daya】Where does the cloud stop when the misunderstanding is stopped. A gentleman is true to life, with no competition in his heart. Popular work?. Textual research: [[Zuo Zhuan·Xiang Ten Years] Zheng Qi is overwhelmed, and the teacher has already competed. 〕 　 I would like to add words based on the original disaster. 〔【Also】Ji Kangzi said that there are social affairs in the town, which makes the fat and the job compete. 〕 　 Please click here for the twenty-three years of mourning. Sincerely, Ji Kangzi

jìng
вм. 竞
Radicals: 立, 兄  (stand, older-brother)
Meaning Mnemonic
Standing next to your older brother is another standing older brother of yours. They're trying to compete, to see which of them can stand the straightest and tallest.
Picture your two older brothers competing like this. Are you going to root for one of them? That's not very nice, you shouldn't have a favorite older brother.
Reading Mnemonic
Your older brothers are trying to compete to see which of them gets to go to きょうと with you. You won a free trip to きょうと, but there's only one other ticket, so now your brothers are competing for you.
Look really closely at your older brothers. They're competing pretty hard for your attention. They really want to go to きょうと... but which one do YOU want to spend time with the most?
